jobDescription: JOB TITLE: Data AnalystDIVISION: Member Services REPORTS TO: Director, ResearchPURPOSEThe purpose of this position is to serve our members and co-workers by supporting marketing efforts and providing meaningful data summaries and analyses.SUMMARYThe person holding this position is responsible for data analysis and information processing solutions that facilitate member recruitment, retention, credentialing, engagement and research.JOB FUNCTIONSInformation Processing and Information Processing Support Activities (45% of Time)Create and maintain library of queries for all data requests.Assist with conversion of current queries to NetForum systemProcess both routine and special query requests for Member Services and the Customer Service Center.Monitor, evaluate and modify information processing activities as needed to meet the goals of the Division and ACHE.Maintain documentation of all process and participate in data governance activities.Coordinate with MIS staff to resolve divisional computer problems as necessary.Data Analysis Activities (25% of Time)Provide Member Services, Senior Management and other staff with timely and accurate routine and ad hoc reports.In collaboration with other Member Services staff, research and understand the needs and desired benefits of ACHE members at all levels.In collaboration with the senior vice president, Member Services or director, Research, identify topics to investigate regarding member recruitment, retention and engagement; determine the data required and conduct data analyses.Survey Support Activities (20% of Time)Assist with programming, fielding and managing surveys; perform data processing and compile summary reports.Assist with sample list management, including sample cleaning, updating the association management system records as needed and to maintain links between individuals and organizations; and draw samples for survey and marketing activities.Marketing Support Activities (10% of Time)Run all membership queries for mailings. Code Members Services emails in HTML on a weekly basis and send them to members and prospects.Track results of Member Services marketing activities, including growth and retention efforts.KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTSInterest in extracting information from data, and ability to learn data analysis toolsBaccalaureate degree in business administration, computer science, marketing, statistics or other relevant field. Masters degree preferred.Three to five years data analysis experience preferredExperience with writing queries using Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or other relational database systems toolsKnowledge of association management software (e.g., NetForum, iMIS) preferred.Experience with the NetForum association management database strongly preferredThree to five years experience with data reporting preferredUnderstanding of applied statisticsFamiliarity with statistical analysis software requiredStrong attention to detail in working with databases, tables/figures and data reports requiredAbility to prioritize, plan, solve problems and carry out responsibilities independently requiredMust have strong customer service and team orientationMust have strong interpersonal and written and verbal communication skillsOTHER REQUIREMENTSMust possess sound judgment, discretion and a high degree of professionalismMust have regular and predictable attendance This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying the position. In addition, percentages allocated to job functions are subject to change at the supervisors discretion. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodations.
